snippet: New Year’s Day is the only holiday devoted to acknowledging, if not precisely celebrating, time itself. And there is nothing stranger than time.
abstract: Editorial suggests that New Year’s Day is the only holiday devoted to acknowledging, if not precisely celebrating, time itself--and muses that there is nothing stranger than time.
lead_paragraph: New Year’s Day is the only holiday devoted to acknowledging, if not precisely celebrating, time itself. And there is nothing stranger than time.
